classFluff.name: Artificer
entries: {@i A Magical Crafter and an Inventor of Wonders}

Masters of invention, Artificers use ingenuity and magic to unlock extraordinary capabilities in objects. They see magic as a complex system waiting to be decoded and then harnessed in their spells and inventions. You can find everything you need to play one of these inventors in the next few sections.

subclassFluff.name: Alchemist
entries: {@i Craft Magic Elixirs and Potions}

entries.name: Design Note: Alchemist Updates
entries: Here are the main updates in this subclass since its appearance in {@book Tasha's Cauldron of Everything|TCE}:

items.name: Alchemist Spells
entries: has replaced {@spell Blight|PHB} with {@spell Vitriolic Sphere|XPHB}.

items.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: now allows the Artificer to craft potions faster.

items.name: Experimental Elixir
entries: now produces more elixirs, the healing of the Healing elixir has increased, and the sixth row of the table now lets you choose an elixir's effect.

items.name: Restorative Reagents
entries: has been changed to connect the Temporary Hit Points to your level.

items.name: Chemical Mastery
entries: has been redesigned. It now includes extra damage, Resistance, and the ability to cast {@spell Tasha's Bubbling Cauldron|XPHB}.

subclassFluff.name: Armorer
entries: {@i Craft Magic Armor to Enhance Your Abilities}

entries.name: Design Note: Armorer
entries: Here are the main updates in this subclass since its appearance in {@book Tasha's Cauldron of Everything|TCE}:

items.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: now allows the Artificer to craft armor faster.

items.name: Armor Model
entries: includes a new armor option: Dreadnaught. In the Guardian option, Defensive Field now relies on you being {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} rather than having limited uses.

items.name: Armor Modifications
entries: has been replaced by a new feature, {@subclassFeature Armor Replication|Artificer|XUA2024Artificer|Armorer|XUA2024Artificer|9|XUA2024Artificer}.

items.name: Perfected Armor
entries: now increases the damage of your Thunder Gauntlets and Lightning Launchers.

spell.name: Homunculus Servant

m.text: a gem or crystal worth 100+ GP, which the spell consumes

entries: You summon a special homunculus in an unoccupied space within range. This creature uses the {@creature Homunculus Servant|XUA2024Artificer} stat block. If you already have a homunculus from this spell, the homunculus is replaced by the new one.
You determine the homunculus's appearance, such as a mechanical-looking bird; winged vials; or miniature, animate cauldrons.

entries.name: Combat
entries: The homunculus is an ally to you and your allies. In combat, it shares your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action and uses its movement to avoid danger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Use the spell slot's level for the spell's level in the stat block.

item.name: Boots of the Winding Path
entries: While wearing these boots, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to teleport up to 15 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You must have occupied that space at some point during the current turn.

item.name: Helm of Awareness
entries: While wearing this helmet, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} rolls.

item.name: Mind Sharpener
entries: The item has 4 charges. When you fail a Constitution saving throw to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and expend 1 of the item's charges to succeed instead. The item regains {@dice 1d4} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Repulsion Shield
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} while wielding this shield.

The shield has 4 charges. While holding it, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} immediately after being hit by a melee attack roll to expend 1 of the shield's charges and push the attacker up to 15 feet away. The shield regains {@dice 1d4} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Spell-Refueling Ring
entries: While wearing this ring, you can recover one expended spell slot as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. The recovered slot can be of level 3 or lower. Once used, the ring can't be used again until the next dawn.

This magic weapon grants a {=bonusWeapon} bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. While holding it, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to cause it to shed {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} in a 30-foot radius and {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} for an additional 30 feet. You can extinguish the light as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

The weapon has 4 charges. You can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} immediately after being hit by an attack roll to expend 1 of the weapon's charges and force the attacker to make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn. The weapon regains {@dice 1d4} expended charges daily at dawn.
This magic weapon grants a {=bonusWeapon} bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it when it's used to make a ranged attack roll, and it ignores {@itemProperty LD|XPHB|Loading} if it has it.

If the weapon lacks ammunition, it produces its own, automatically creating one piece of magic ammunition when the wielder makes a ranged attack with it. The ammunition created by the weapon vanishes the instant after it hits or misses a target.
This magic weapon grants a {=bonusWeapon} bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and it returns to your hand immediately after it is used to make a ranged attack roll.

hp.special: 5 + 5 per spell level (the homunculus has a number of Hit Dice [d4s] equal to the spell's level)

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the homunculus is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the homunculus instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the save and only half damage if it fails. It can't use this trait if it has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

trait.name: Magic Bond
entries: Add the spell level to any ability check or saving throw the homunculus makes.

action.name: Force Strike
entries: {@atkr m,r} Bonus equals {@hitYourSpellAttack}, reach 5 ft. or range 30 ft. {@h}{@dice 1d6} plus the spell's level of Force damage.

reaction.name: Channel Magic
entries: {@actTrigger} You cast a spell that has a range of touch while the homunculus is within 120 feet of you. {@actResponse} The homunculus delivers the spell through its touch.

hp.special: 5 + five times your Artificer level (the defender has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your Artificer level)

trait.name: Steel Bond
entries: Add your Proficiency Bonus to any ability check or saving throw the defender makes.

action.name: Force-Empowered Rend
entries: {@atkr m} Bonus equals {@hitYourSpellAttack}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@dice 1d8 + 2} plus your Intelligence modifier Force damage.

action.name: Repair (3/Day)
entries: The defender, or one Construct or object it can see within 5 feet of it, regains a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 2d8} plus your Intelligence modifier.

reaction.name: Deflect Attack
entries: {@actTrigger} A creature the defender can see within 5 feet of it makes an attack roll targeting a different creature. {@actResponse} The triggering creature makes the attack roll with {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

object.name: Eldritch Cannon

hp.special: 5 × your artificer level (casting {@spell mending|XPHB} on the cannon restores {@dice 2d6} hit points to it

entries: {@note Created by the {@subclassFeature Eldritch Cannon|Artificer|XUA2024Artificer|Artillerist|XUA2024Artificer|3} subclass feature.}

actionEntries.name: Activate Cannon (Requires You to be within 60 Feet of the Cannon)
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you order the cannon to use the Flamethrower, Force Ballista, or Protector option below; you can direct the cannon to move up to 15 feet before or after that option:

items.name: Flamethrower
entries: The cannon exhales fire in a 15-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. Each creature in that area makes a Dexterity saving throw against {@dcYourSpellSave}, taking {@damage 2d8} Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. Flammable objects in the {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone} that aren't being worn or carried start burning.

items.name: Force Ballista
entries: Make a ranged spell attack originating from the cannon at one creature or object within 120 feet of it. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d8} Force damage, and if the target is a creature, it is pushed up to 5 feet away from the cannon.

items.name: Protector
entries: The cannon emits a burst of positive energy that grants itself and each creature of your choice within 10 feet of it a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 1d8} plus your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1).

table.name: Core Artificer Traits
rows: {@i Choose 2:} {@skill Arcana|XPHB}, {@skill History|XPHB}, {@skill Investigation|XPHB}, {@skill Medicine|XPHB}, {@skill Nature|XPHB}, {@skill Perception|XPHB}, or {@skill Sleight of Hand|XPHB}
{@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}, {@item Tinker's Tools|XPHB}, and one type of Artisan's Tools of your choice
Light and Medium armor and Shields
Choose A or B: (A) {@item Studded Leather Armor|XPHB}, {@item Dagger|XPHB}, {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}, {@item Tinker's Tools|XPHB}, {@item Dungeoneer's Pack|XPHB}, and 16 GP; or (B) 150 GP

data.name: Unearthed Arcana 2024: The Artificer
entries: This playtest document is part of a series of {@i Unearthed Arcana} articles that present material designed for upcoming books. The material here uses the rules in the {@book 2024 Player's Handbook|XPHB}.

entries.name: Learn More on YouTube
entries: To learn more about the design in this article, we invite you to view the videos about it on YouTube ({@link www.youtube.com/DNDWizards}).

items.name: Artificer
entries: A revised Artificer is the star of the show.

items.name: Additional Magic Options
entries: A new spell and a collection of magic items enhance the options available to Artificers.

entries.name: This Is Playtest Material
entries: This article is presented for playtesting and feedback. The options here are experimental and in draft form. They aren't officially part of the game. Your feedback will help determine whether we adopt it as official.

items.name: How to Playtest This UA
entries: We invite you to try out this material in play. To play with this material, you may either incorporate it into your campaign or run one or more special playtest sessions. For such a session, you may create an adventure of your own or use a short adventure from a source like {@adventure Quests from the Infinite Staircase|QftIS}.

items.name: Power Level
entries: The character options you read here might be more or less powerful than options in the {@book 2024 Player's Handbook|XPHB}. If a design survives playtesting, we adjust its power to the desirable level before publication. This means an option could be more or less powerful in its final form.

items.name: Feedback
entries: The best way for you to give us feedback on this material is in the survey we'll release on D&D Beyond. If we make this material official, it will be refined based on your feedback, and then it will appear in a D&D book.
Providing feedback on this document is one way you can help shape the future of D&D!

entries.name: Artificer
entries: {@i A Magical Crafter and an Inventor of Wonders}

Masters of invention, Artificers use ingenuity and magic to unlock extraordinary capabilities in objects. They see magic as a complex system waiting to be decoded and then harnessed in their spells and inventions. You can find everything you need to play one of these inventors in the next few sections.

entries.name: As a Level 1 Character
items: Gain all the traits in the Core Artificer Traits table.
Gain the Artificer's level 1 features, which are listed in the Artificer Features table.

entries.name: As a Multiclass Character
items: Gain the following traits from the {@table Core Artificer Traits|XUA2024Artificer} table: Hit Point Die, proficiency with {@item Tinker's Tools|XPHB}, proficiency in one skill of your choice from the Artificer's skill list, and training with Light and Medium armor and Shields.

Gain the Artificer's level 1 features, which are listed in the Artificer Features table. See the multiclassing rules in the {@book Player's Handbook|XPHB|2|Multiclassing} to determine your available spell slots, adding half your Artificer levels (round up).

entries.name: Artificer Class Features
entries: As an Artificer, you gain the following class features when you reach the specified Artificer levels. These features are listed on the Artificer Features table.

entries.name: Design Note: Artificer Updates
entries: Here are the main updates in this class since its appearance in {@book Tasha's Cauldron of Everything|TCE}:

items.name: Magical Tinkering
entries: now allows the Artificer to craft low-cost items quickly.

items.name: Spellcasting
entries: now allows the Artificer to change one cantrip after each Long Rest.

items.name: Infuse Item
entries: has been redesigned and renamed to {@classFeature Replicate Magic Item|Artificer|XUA2024Artificer|2|XUA2024Artificer}. The feature allows the Artificer to replicate any magic item of a qualifying rarity and item type.

items.name: Magic Item Tinker
entries: replaces {@classFeature Tool Expertise|Artificer|TCE|6|TCE} and lets you turn a magic item into a spell slot.

items.name: Flash of Genius
entries: is now used in response to an ability check or a saving throw failing.

items.name: Spell-Storing Item
entries: has been changed to include level 3 Artificer spells.

items.name: Soul of Artifice
entries: no longer requires a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to cheat death, and it restores you to 20 Hit Points instead of 1. The feature's other benefit now enhances ability checks.

entries.name: Artificer Spell List
entries: This section presents the Artificer spell list. The spells are organized by spell level and then alphabetized, and each spell's school of magic is listed. In the Special column, {@i C} means the spell requires {@status Concentration|XPHB}, {@i R} means it's a {@variantrule Ritual|XPHB}, and {@i M} means it requires a specific Material component.

entries.name: Design Note: Spell List Updates
entries: The Artificer spell list includes the following new spells:

items.name: Cantrips:
entries: {@spell Elementalism|XPHB}, {@spell True Strike|XPHB}

items.name: Level 2:
entries: {@spell Arcane Vigor|XPHB}, {@spell Dragon's Breath|XPHB}, {@spell Homunculus Servant|XUA2024Artificer}

items.name: Level 5:
entries: {@spell Circle of Power|XPHB}

The list includes only spells from the {@book Player's Handbook|XPHB} and this article. If you have {@book Tasha's Cauldron of Everything|XPHB}, your Artificer can continue to use {@filter the class's spells in that book|spells|source=tce|class=artificer}.

entries.name: Artificer Subclasses
entries: An Artificer subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Artificer levels, as specified in the subclass. This section presents the {@subclass Alchemist|Artificer|XUA2024Artificer|XUA2024Artificer}, {@subclass Armorer|Artificer|XUA2024Artificer|XUA2024Artificer}, {@subclass Artillerist|Artificer|XUA2024Artificer|XUA2024Artificer}, and {@subclass Battle Smith|Artificer|XUA2024Artificer|XUA2024Artificer}.

entries.name: Design Note: Magic Items
entries: The magic items presented here appeared as Artificer infusions in {@book Tasha's Cauldron of Everything|TCE}. As magic items, they can be created with an Artificer's {@classFeature Replicate Magic Item|Artificer|XUA2024Artificer|2|XUA2024Artificer} feature, and they can also be found as treasure or crafted using the rules in the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|XDMG|6}.
The following infusions from {@book Tasha's Cauldron of Everything|TCE} have been replaced with other options:

items: Instead of the {@optfeature Enhanced Arcane Focus|TCE} infusion, an Artificer can use {@classFeature Replicate Magic Item|Artificer|XUA2024Artificer|2|XUA2024Artificer} to make a {@item +1 Wand of the War Mage|XDMG}.

Instead of the {@optfeature Enhanced Defense|TCE} infusion, an Artificer can use {@classFeature Replicate Magic Item|Artificer|XUA2024Artificer|2|XUA2024Artificer} to make {@item +1 Armor|XDMG} or a {@item +1 Shield|XDMG}.
Instead of the {@optfeature Enhanced Weapon|TCE} infusion, an Artificer can use {@classFeature Replicate Magic Item|Artificer|XUA2024Artificer|2|XUA2024Artificer} to make a {@item +1 Weapon|XDMG}.
The {@optfeature Homunculus Servant|TCE} infusion is replaced by {@spell Homunculus Servant|XUA2024Artificer|a spell of the same name} (in the previous section).

entries: In addition, the {@optfeature Mind Sharpener|TCE} infusion is now a magic ring rather than an infusion that can be applied to armor or robes.
